snippet: Research suggests that as a result of parents’ problematic schedules, children’s language and problem-solving skills may suffer and they may be more likely to smoke and drink as they grow older.
abstract: Some employers, among them Abercrombie & Fitch and Starbucks, have responded to demands from workers for more regular and predictable work schedules; employees may not be only beneficiaries of such changes, as studies suggest that children's language and problem-solving skills may suffer when their parents have unpredictable work schedules;
lead_paragraph: Research suggests that as a result of parents’ problematic schedules, children’s language and problem-solving skills may suffer and they may be more likely to smoke and drink as they grow older.

headline.main: The Perils of Ever-Changing Work Schedules Extend to Children’s Well-Being
headline.print_headline: When Shifting Work Schedules Hurt Children’s Well-Being
